comments.body: I'm thinking you still have a telescope but each time you combine it with an ender eye it zooms in much further.
That sounds like the item we need.

Ropes can be extended from dispensers. When on they will extend the rope and when off they will retract it. They can also shoot the rope arrows when first activated and then pull it back on the second activation. I also had the idea that if you wanted to not extend a rope fully you could activate two sides of the dispenser and it would stop it from retracting or extending. Another idea is that dispensers will always extend fully, but if the rope reaches the ground it will create a coiled rope block which gets higher the more rope is in it.

Other variants of rope could be vines and webs, which would be generated by spiders to lower themselves. All of these can be crafted to become thicker variants. Rope would become ladders, vines would become the current vines, and webs would go from a string to a block that can spread across blocks like glass panes.
Add them please
Pets should respawn if they die. Same way a player respawns. But if they have not slept, then they couldn't respawn.
Also something like a nest or cage for parrots.
Yes it's great idea üëç like copper and honeycomb or when you color sign panel with dye ü™ß

This would be nice, but it would defeat the challenge of trying to put in the redstone circuitry to do so. A good idea, but kinda defeats the challenges. Also music is not detected by the sculk sensor. Awesome idea.
How about adding in a minecart with Shulker Box? IE a minecart with chest but when broken the items stay in the shulker part of it.

Also, you should be able to have powered minecarts that you can ride and multiple players per cart. Also minecarts that can carry players and have a chest. This would all be very helpful in the caves and cliffs update.
You could do so much with this. Imagine all the treasure maps with hidden clues!!!
This is a great idea! Beacon beams are sometimes very difficult to integrate into bases, and they can spoil the view, especially if there are a lot of them.
And maybe a full wool set
I like the idea but I think this functionality should be applied to leather boots instead.

Can we have more info? This said that we should have custom bed and thats it nothing on how we would obtain them or whether it would be something you can only get in creative or if anything else would be needed to make this just that you want custom beds
do you mean as in you can create custom beds using banners?

Maybe instead of having the ladders hang, we can introduce Rope Ladders!  When placed on the end of a block, it‚Äôll expand downwards until it hits the surface.  Weird explanation from me but I can see this...
Weeping vines are a good option.
I really think we need to have more placable food. the only food we can display is cake and adding this would be really cute and aesthetic without being to complicated or changing gameplay
IS IT OUT?

I think pots could act just like cauldrons, that means you can put different hights of water into them. This would add to the decorative aspect of them. But I'm not quite shure about the potion storing.

Another possibility could be that Ceramic Pots have a inventory (like chests or barrels) with only one row of inventory slots. This way they are decorative but dont have so much storage space...
Or could place a flower in it

the idea is nice, but most of the swords would be quite useless, because iron/diamond would probably stronger anyways. The making table is a kinda neat idea, but it wouldnt be that good, because it has only this one purpose and the sword of minecraft would be way too op. the damage of all the swords combined would be way too op. like at least 25dmg with no enchants is way too powerful.
no
How the heck could you make a redstone sword it would just fall apart
I agree with everything except the fall damage-why would wool be better than Netherite? It should be a risk-reward system.

Maybe something to make this harder to obtain?

Or possibly just very low durability

 

Multiple people have this idea, but its all a bit different

I support it though
385744557511 I mean it's plausible, that's why you can reduce your fall damage when you fall onto a hay bale not a netherite block.
Yeah i had the same idea maybe be like a potion of nausea
I think the item should be bioluminescence and you can use it to make glow potions.

That sounds like a great idea! Maybe a potion of glowing. Will stun mobs in a set radius for the drinkable version and for the splash version have it stun mobs/players for a short amount of time

Time lengths:

Drinkable: 2:00 and 4:00 by adding redstone

Splash: 0:10 and 0:15 by adding redstone
This a very goud idea
Copper oxidizes in oxygen not in water, while this is a cool idea it would not be scientifically accurate (if mojang cares about that in this case)

Nitric acid (aka aqua fortis) reacts with copper to form cupric nitrate. Cupric nitrate is the traditional chemical used to patina copper or bronze to a nice blue green. Minecraft could easily add a potion recipe for ‚ÄòAqua Fortis‚Äô (very minecrafty name), and then one for cupric nitrate- aqua fortis plus copper ingot (oxidizing potion) and then we could use that for instant oxidizing. I think this is something you should have to work for though, a water filled cauldron is not enough.

But this must somehow be implemented for the players. Under this effect, players themselves will not be able to inflict damage. What about mechanisms and flint, buckets of lava? Does it mean that players will still be able to inflict damage to each other indirectly?

For players, who aren't inherently hostile, the potion of peace has to work a little differently. I think it could adopt a similar form to the status effect resistance, given to players through turtle master potions, beacons and enchanted golden apples.

This means the potion of peace would provide a buff against damages except for starvation, the void, /kill and boss mobs. 

As it works in the same way as resistance, this means that indirect damage still affects the player, but to a lesser degree.
this would be great! but i dont think glowstone should affect it
y e e s
Instead of an enchantment, it could be a type of bait, possibly crafted with Glow Squid drops
The bait could lure the fish mobs, making them easier to scoop up or kill, or just lure to another place
It could also repel Drowned, but not Glowing Drowned
I'd personally rather have it as enchantment than bait, the bait would probably change the effect too much
This would cause so much heartburn lol
No.
The gas mask was a good idea.
Maybe pyrous gas(pyro as in fire) could be added and anything inside gets burn damage
I think gases could, rather than being a new fluid type like water or lava, simply be a lingering potion effect that spawns on chance of mining coal.
F√ºr die Education Edition
Each Air Block Can Give 10 Seconds Of Oxygen.If You Ran Out Of Oxygen, You‚Äôll Slowly Suffocate.
how about different gas masks?

I like the idea and the gas mask thing. I went ahead and tried to make a texture for them.

I based it off the picture in the top left.

I think one way that can replace the use of gas masks, which are very modern for the game, is the use of incense sticks. They could be manufactured using flowers and sticks, by placing them on the floor, they could neutralize hostile gases with their aroma, in addition to serving as lanterns, since they would need to be accessed. They could have a recharge system, as they would only burn for a few moments and then the player should replenish with more flowers.
It will be cool if you can craft gas masks to go in.
The wither gas doesn't make any sense to me however the poison gas/gasmask idea sounds viable, perhaps you should add some glass into the gas mask recipe.
I like the idea, but mojang probably won't do the gas mask for many reasons
But, to keep Minecraft "easy", that gas that is only in the mineshaft.
Gas mobs is a good idea too
Hello mojang, why don't you implement soul blazes or soul lava?
Or leather helmet and charcoal
SULFUR CAVE?!?!?!?

This could be extremely useful.

It should not be allowed to be combined with the curse of binding enchantment.  Otherwise you could get a piece of armor (or a pumpkin head) that you can literally never get rid of.

It would also be incompatible with curse of vanishing for obvious reasons xP
The main reason I came up with it was because of me making the perfect set of armor in a survival server then dieing far away from my base.
there should be a penalty, for example an instant loss of durability, or you do not respawn with full hunger and hearts.

At cost of your items durability

takes 5-10% of your items durability or maybe more

This would be up there with Mending as being one of the best high-powered enchantments. 

 

To that end, I would say that it should not be coupled with Mending.  Similar to how they nerfed Mending/Infinity bows. 

 

I love the idea though.  I could easily see this being added provided that it is kept rare and in check.
This is a great idea and I'd like to see it in game. You have my vote!

A very powerful enchantment. Should be like Mending and FrostWalker and never be accessible from enchantment tables. Should conflict with both curses and Mending - no penalties should be needed because the fact that it conflicts with the curses would make it appear less often, and the fact that you cannot apply mending means it would break eventually. If it's still too strong, maybe it could conflict with unbreaking, though that wouldn't be ideal. I actually had this idea as well - good thing I searched to see if there was another one.

Another idea is maybe instead of just being soulbound it has 3 levels:

Soulbound I would have a 60% chance to keep affected item upon death

Soulbound II would have an 80% chance to keep affected item upon death

Soulbound III would have a 100% chance to keep affected item upon death. Possibly only be obtainable if you combined two level 2 soulbound enchants.

I could see this enchant seeing a ton of use in map making, especially if there were 3 levels.
What if the enchantment ALSO prevents the enchanted item from being transferred to chests or dropped? (in survival)

Instead of applying it to armor, I thought about applying the neverdrop effect to an equipment / inventory slot - gained by the effect of a neverdrop potion, which would be brewed with an item dropped from bosses with ~ 5% chance. Randomly 1 slot would be

- enchanted with the neverdrop effect, (medium chance)

- cursed (all items placed in that slot would receive "binding" or "vanish") (medium chance)

- freed of an enchantment (low chance)

- freed of a curse (high chance)

- freed of ALL enchantments and curses (very low chance)

The effect would be put on all players in range of the throwing potion effect that also have eaten a golden apple. Every player would receive a random effect for himself. 

This would encourage players to shape teams and go for the bosses together.

This is an outstanding concept. It would conflict with the 2 curses, and it would be a way to ensure at least some of your hard work making good gear won't be lost, however, I think it should take some durability upon the wearer's (or holder's) death (25% of that tool's max durability seems fair), as it would be too overpowered to keep it forever, especially when combined with mending for repair. For this reason, it should be incompatible with mending too.

Balancing would likely be required.
Perhaps the enchantment should disappear after death? That way, if rare, the player is forced to make a choice between applying multiples of this enchantment to multiple items, or store them for the future.
As pointed out before, it should be incompatible with Curse of Vanishing and Curse of Binding.
Combining it with mending might be balanced if the enchantment disappears as I said before.
The three levels as proposed by WaitingBaker might also be needed for balancing reasons. However if the enchantment is extremely rare, this combination might make the enchantment more of a chore, than something usefull.
The penalty should really depends on its rarity.
I feel like we need more end-game features in Minecraft and this one has a lot of potential to end up in the game.

You should be able to add this to any item, so you could keep a netherite block, ingot, or scrap, nether star, etc. upon death. The only downside i can see to this is putting everything you want with it in a shulker box that has it, then you'd only need to enchant one thing for the effect of lots of things, so maybe not shulker boxes.
I would love to see this in game!
I am honestly surprised this has not been even announced as potential future enchantments yet. I'm hoping that it will be üôè.
I lie like this idea, and maybe it can lower the sound of footsteps entirely, instead of only affecting the vibration level.
I like this a lot, very smart.
I say if this is added it should be a treasure enchantment found somewhere in the deep dark.
What a GOOD enchantment!
I can call my boots sneakers now
I think it should be found in dungeons
maybe it should be found in the deep dark in those little outpost thingies we saw at minecon
How Close would you be able to get, like how close would you be able to get without making a vibration

I disagree. The reason why i disagree with this is because while it is a good idea, it just eliminates the entire purpose of the warden with just an enchantment since it basically makes you invisible to the warden. Mojang doesnt want players to just use an enchantment and get permanent protection from wardens, they want us to think of strategies to avoid it or methods of fighting it. I believe that this enchantment would make the warden useless.
cool. Howabout an IV too?

I like the idea. Maybe eatch level cuts vibration of footsteps by 5% so its not to overpowered. That way the Warden is still an issue. And I think the loot should be found in Deep Dark chest or dropped by the Warden.
Amazing idea!
W-what's the W-warden?
I really liked the idea, maybe this enchantment could be found in structures in the deepdark cellars, as shown in the trailer.
cave and cliff
I like it

If i remember correctly, Mojang said there will be all variants of slabs, walls and stairs for stone types, and all variants for stairs, fences, fence gates, pressure plates, buttons and doors. Since Polished versions are `stone[type=polished_*]`, they should be added for consistency.
Also smooth stone walls & stairs

I find it to be very strange that Polished Granite, Andesite, and Diorite do not have wall variants because they already have slabs and stairs, so why can't they have walls? It would make my buildings that use walls look much nicer since I would not have to use the unpolished versions every time I use the polished versions for everything else.
i just made a post about the exact same thing! im glad to see other people want this change made as well best of luck to you and hopefully polished walls are added!
I am building a laboratory and I need to command /setblock -- - ---- diorite_wall but it doesn't exist so I am very sad ;-;

I agree with you and I think there should be a bunch of materials, variants of them, and their forms.

I would like to add smooth stone stairs and walls, as well as new blocks entirely like Slate, Marble, or Limestone.
I would like this to satisfy my OCD for consistency as well.

It's been over 4 years, please fix this.

Additional variants for blocks that already have Walls would be appreciated, like Dark Prismarine Walls or Smooth Sandstone Walls.
Polished diorite walls asap... Currently using polished blocks for perimeter walls... Only use polished diorite with city texture pack looks way better

Im sure that this isn't going to be a priority for the people over at Mojang, but as an avid player of thier game, I would rather see a game drop where they perfect existing features rather than add new content (the copper golem for example). They have worked very hard to create an amazing game, but for people like me in the community who apretiate consistency, 'bugs'/out right missing features like these really make me loose faith in the development team, seeing that they are choosing not to implement these 'less  sparkily' additions. Im not sure where other players stand on this issue, but I think it might be time to see a change in Mojang leadership, someone who cares about not just the game, but about its fanbase too, and who will listen to the playerbase and fix these annoying discrepancies. Sorry for the rant plz add more stone wall varients.

Hi there, Please keep suggestions focused on a single idea per post. There are really interesting suggestions here, but they really belong in their own posts (and some in different categories). Thanks.
